JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in ORG , GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr A. Schwierzy , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant worked in the town of GPE in GPE . In DATE the applicant moved to the town of PERSON in GPE , where he worked until his departure to GPE in DATE . In DATE the applicant received a permanent residence permit in GPE .
In DATE , according to the applicant , he reached the age of retirement , as he had worked in hazardous conditions and was , therefore , entitled to an early pension .

In a letter of DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant that , in accordance with the PERSON of GPE on Pensions , pensions should not be granted to citizens who had left for permanent residence abroad .
On DATE the applicant again requested ORG of GPE to grant him a pension but received a refusal since he had not submitted a NORP passport .

At DATE a certain NORP lodged a complaint before ORG on behalf of the applicant challenging the refusal of ORG to pay him pension . On DATE the court found that the ORG 's refusal was based on the legal provisions in force and that the applicant was not entitled to pension payments since he had not been residing in GPE since DATE .
Section CARDINAL of the Law of GPE on Pensions provides that an old - age pension is granted to men from DATE and with work experience of DATE .
Section CARDINAL of the Law of GPE on Pensions provides for situations in which a man can receive an early retirement pension at DATE .
Other relevant domestic law is summarised in the PERSON v. GPE decision ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) .
